subject: Sales
title: Consent in the Sales Process
description: One-minute skill: Consent in the Sales Process.

hook.text: A buyer feels cornered and signs under pressure. A week later they cancel and warn everyone they know.

buildup.text: Consent in sales means the buyer genuinely agrees, not that they were maneuvered into agreement.

discovery.text: True consent requires clear information, visible alternatives, and adequate time. Remove one and it fails.

twist.text: High-pressure closes win signatures but lose customers. Forced yeses always become regretful nos.

climax.text: Ask for permission at every stage. 'Does continuing make sense?' honors the buyer's autonomy.

punchline.text: A forced yes always becomes a regretful no.

quiz.question: What does genuine consent require in sales?
options: Clear information, alternatives, and adequate time
